articles.description: Australian fans are split on whether major competitions should resume during the COVID-19 pandemic, according to new research.
articles.content: "Theres a level of doubt or uncertainty about whether sport should return," said True North director Georgie Maynard. "For many it is a signal of a return to normal life and a much-needed distraction but, for others, its something that is irresponsible and ev… [+2519 chars]

articles.author: Eamonn Tiernan
articles.title: Shock AFL ruling adds fuel to Kane Cornes’ ‘Vic bias’ outrage - 7NEWS.com.au
articles.description: “This is an absolute joke, it just underlines how VFL-centric the AFL still are.”
articles.content:
Kane Cornes has teed off again.
This time at the AFL for stopping Western Australian clubs training in larger numbers after the state relaxed its lockdown laws.
Three weeks ago Cornes lashed supposed bias out of Victorias footy community, arguing they gloss… [+1933 chars]

articles.author: Roy Masters
articles.title: Why an October 25 grand final saves NRL another massive headache - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Some NRL stars would have had to renegotiate their club contracts if the season extended into November.
articles.content:
One complication would have been players unavailable for their new clubs from November 1 because they had not completed commitments with their existing one.
For example, if St George Illawarra and Newcastle contested a November grand final, what is the statu… [+3670 chars]

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: Easton Wood’s premiership medal stolen, AFL - NEWS.com.au
articles.description: Western Bulldogs star has premiership medal stolen
articles.content:
Western Bulldogs star Easton Woods AFL premiership medal has been stolen. Victoria Police allege it was taken during a burglary in the inner Melbourne suburb of Albert Park between April 14 and 26.
Wood, 30, stood in for injured captain Bob Murphy in the Bul… [+1102 chars]

articles.author: Richard Callander
articles.title: Rain to determine Wagga Cup line up - Racenet
articles.description: The city of Wagga Wagga is ready to host two cracking days featuring the $160,000 Listed Gold Cup (2000m) albeit without the usual hustle and bustle of a capacity crowd and a town bursting at the seams.
articles.content:
The city of Wagga Wagga is ready to host two cracking days on Thursday and Friday albeit without the usual hustle and bustle of a capacity crowd and a town bursting at the seams.
The Murrumbidgee Turf Club has assembled a cracking line up for the $160,000 Li… [+2358 chars]

articles.title: News Viewed Former player among assistant coaches axed by Crows 'Unfortunate decisions' - Australian Football League
articles.description: 'Unfortunate decisions' lead to Marty Mattner and Paul Thomas leaving their roles at Adelaide
articles.content:
ASSISTANT coach Marty Mattner is leaving Adelaide as the AFL club restructures coaching ranks amid the coronavirus pandemic.
Mattner, who had been at the Crows since late 2018, follows development coach Paul Thomas in departing the club.

articles.title: ‘Worse than coronavirus’: Chris Gayle lashes out at former teammate - Fox Sports
articles.description: Chris Gayle said Ramnaresh Sarwan was “worse than the coronavirus” as he blamed his “evil” former West Indies teammate for his exit from the Jamaica Tallawahs team in the Caribbean Premier League.
articles.content:
The 40-year-old Gayle was released by Twenty20 franchise the Tallawahs last week and the big-hitting opener held assistant coach Sarwan responsible during a remarkable 15-minute video posted on his YouTube channel.
Right now Sarwan, you are worse than the co… [+2378 chars]

articles.title: Wallabies legend Tim Horan wants Pacific Islands included in Super Rugby revamp - Fox Sports
articles.description: Wallabies great Tim Horan has called for Pacific Island nations to be part of a new-look Super Rugby model, with their teams based out of cities in Australia and New Zealand.
articles.content:
The Sanzaar competition looks set to undergo a major revamp from next year, with New Zealand Rugby having announced a wholesale review into every aspect following the outbreak of COVID-19.
